intro: Memecylon gabonense, commonly known as African memecylon, is a species of flowering plant in the family Melastomataceae. It is native to Central and West Africa, including countries like Gabon, Cameroon, and Nigeria. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its leaves are opposite, ovate to elliptic in shape, and often have a glossy surface. The flowers are small, clustered in inflorescences, and usually have five petals, with a color range from white to pink.
